Articles.Content:
Ciao, avrei bisogno di un aiuto per kerbal space program. Io per installare le mod uso ckan, pero vorrei scaricare delle mod che non supportano la mia versione di kerbal space program. Come faccio a cambiare la versione di kerbal space program? La mia versione è 1.1.3.1289 e mi servono delle versioni precedenti per installare le mod. Come faccio ?

Mod edit (thanks google translate):

Hello, I need your help Kerbal Space Program. I install the mods CKAN use, but I would like to download the mod that do not support my version of Kerbal Space Program. How do I change the version of Kerbal Space Program? My version is 1.1.3.1289 and I need previous versions to install the mod. How can I do ?

Edited September 7, 2016 by Red Iron Crown

IF you install your current mods on a previous version of ksp then it is  very unlikely that they will work.  What is the version that you would like to install? you are also unlikely to receive any support for a mod that is not updated or maintained to current version 1.1.3
I added a google translation to your post, @Frr. Please keep posts in the main sections of the forum in English; if you'd rather write in Italian check out the International section.
Mods are 1.1.0 and ksp is version 1.1.3.1289. Is it possibile to install the mods?
It depends on the mods, some mods would work fine, some will have minor issues, some won't work at all.
Is not possibile tochange the version of ksp?

If you are installing a mod through CKAN, you can effectively "change" the version of KSP by editting the readme file, but it is probably better and easier to install the mod manually (Downloading the file through browser, and extract the gamefile folder to ksp folder).

Hello! CKAN there 'the "Filter" option if "All" is selected, you should see all the mods even those for previous versions of KSP. To install them, however, 'you should change the Readme.txt file in the root folder Kerbal and change the version shown them that interests you. I do not know what this involves, however, 'never done before. Usually old hack to install manually.

@Epox75, I ran your post through Google translate, but in future, please post in English when outside of the International Subforums. -- Vanamonde
